fields.name: Château de Saint Cosme Little James` Basket Press rouge
fields.description:
The Château de Saint Cosme Little James` Basket Press rouge is a pure Grenache, whose grapes result from different locations in the southern Rhône area. Main part is always the youngest vintage (50%) The other 50% assemble out of the previous vintages.
Aromas of cherry, oriental spices, gingerbread, strawberry compote and vanilla.

fields.name: Simonsvlei Zenzela Charming Red
fields.description:
A well rounded, medium-bodied, easy drinking wine with spicy/smoky aromas.

AGEING POTENTIAL
It is a wine to be enjoyed immediately or stored away for a couple of months.

fields.name: Messias Vinho Verde
fields.description: Pale citrus colour. Intense and fresh aroma. Medium sweet and a fresh acidity in mouth.

fields.name: Marisco The Ned Pinot Rosé 2017 Magnum (1,5L)
fields.description:
Targeted vineyard sites for both varieties where the fruit balance and crop exposure was maintained to ensure even ripening and optimum fruit balance was achieved for this style of wine.

This inaugural Rosé release offers up a classic bouquet of red berries and cream, enriched by a broader element of tree-ripened persimmon with hints of faintly floral cherry and rose-tinged top notes.

A neatly rounded, fleshy mouthful with that same creamy, summer berry fruits running through its core, all neatly balanced with bright, crisp acidity and a dusting of fine melon.

fields.name: Miguel Torres Floralis Moscatel Oro NV (0,5L)
fields.description: Of a fine amberish colour, with dark topaz tints, it exhibits in all their splendour the fruity (orange blossom honey, candied orange, lemon peel, raisins), floral (rose, geranium, lily) and spiced (tobacco leaf, rosewood, clove) aromas of the Moscatel variety. On the palate it is a marvel of balance: its honeyed, perfumed sugars are set off by a fine fruity acidity.

fields.name: Château Rieussec Carmes de Rieussec 2011
fields.description: The second wine of Château Rieussec is selected according to the same standards as the first wine. Its constant feature is that it has been centred on a fine aromatic structure dominated by citrus aromas. The name, Carmes de Rieussec, relates to the monks of the Carmes de Langon, who were owners of the Rieussec estate in the 18th century.

fields.name: Vinicola Salton Intenso Tannat 2013
fields.description: Wine with intense purple color with aromas resembling fruit such as blueberries, blackberries, plums and dry leaves, mushroom, nuts, eucalyptus mint, black pepper and other spices. Its tannins are remarkable with good permanence of the flavors in the mouth.

fields.name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild Château Lafite-Roths
fields.description: A deep bouquet of dark fruit and liquorice. The palate is full-bodied and surprisingly expressive, but then becomes tighter, expressing power and exuberance. The youth of this Lafite does not hide its energy, but the distinctive elegance and complexity are already there!

fields.name: Vega Sicilia Reserva Especial 06/07/09
fields.description: An enchanting fruity bouquet. On the palate, the wine is fatty and smooth. It also shows a nice freshness and an aromatic persistence with red fruit nuances.

fields.name: Château Prieuré-Lichine Margaux 2011
fields.description: Intense colour with purplish glints. Pure and intense, dominated by notes of very ripe red fruit. Powerful, rich and voluptuous, offering density and remarkable depth. Precise tannic structure that reveals a phenolic  maturity  worthy of a great vintage. Plenty of substance in the finish with good tannic and aromatic length.

fields.name: d`Arenberg The Twentyeight Road Mourvèdre 2014
fields.description:
This wine has a deep bright crimson-ruby colour with lifted spicy clove, cranberry and[br]ripening blackberry primary fruit smells, elements of mulberry, raspberry, light[br]blackcurrant, cinnamon and vanilla liquorice, as well as mint, dried herbs, iodine and[br]flowers - in particular violets, which are also evident on the young palate.
The flavours begin with vibrant floral fruits and a medium-bodied elegant sweetness.
The flavour grows, as do the vibrant fruit tannins. Rich oak tannins add round weight.
The fragrant, very complex dried herb and iodine characters grow with tannins freshening the palate. Its medium to full-flavoured fruit weight dominates softer, rounded vanilla-mocha oak flavours, before a long, fine acid and slightly sour cherry tannin like finish.
After some bottle age, Mourvèdre should soften in colour. The palate should also develop and integrate with soft prune, cranberry, velvety, earthy and chocolate flavours and a vibrant fresh acid and a plentiful fine-grained tannin finish for quite some time.

fields.name: Xanadu Exmoor Shiraz 2013
fields.description: Deep red with ruby hues. The wine exhibits vibrant, characteristic aromas of ripe blackcurrants, berry fruits, and dark plums entwined with hints of spicy, toasty oak. The generous palate is packed full of jubey forest fruits, cassis and chocolate characters. Full bodied, these attractive fleshy fruits fit into a structure supported by fine boned tannins, and a persistent berry fruit finish.

fields.name: Firriato Harmonium Sicilia DOC 2013
fields.description: A dark, almost black ruby red appears in the glass. The Firriato Harmonium Sicilia DOC shows aromas of cherries and ripe plums. On the palate the mighty and warm body with its pleasing strong tannins surprises.

fields.name: Casa Carmela Dulce 2019
fields.description: Dark red color: with notes of blackberry and blueberry jam, sweet, smooth and balanced in taste with a pleasant spice in the finish.

fields.name: DFJ Vinhos Portada Tinto 2019
fields.description:
This deep, ruby red, medium-bodied wine has berry fruit flavours and a beautiful balance.

Excellent with food or by itself. Will accompany, for example, roasts, barbecues, pasta, vegetarian and cheese dishes.

The wine is aged in American, French of Allier and Portuguese oak barrels for 3 months.

fields.name: Domaine Henri Ruppert Schengen Markusberg Pinot Gr
fields.description: A Pinot Gris from Luxembourg that tastes like citrus fruits and sweet pears.

fields.name: Príncipe de Viana Edition Blanca 2016
fields.description: Príncipe de Viana Edición Blanca, a white wine with an attractive and bright greenish yellow colour and fresh notes of citric fruits such as lime and grapefruit, intertwined with hints of pineapple, apricot and box. The palate is fresh, full-bodied and with a balanced acidity, all of which provides the wine with a lively fresh character and a long aftertaste.

fields.name: Jacaranda Old Vine Chenin Blanc 2015
fields.description: Made from 38 years old Chenin Blanc, complex, concentrated multi-layered. On the nose, apple and quince notes, which carry through to the palate. Beautiful fruit, elegant acidity and well-integrated oak.

fields.name: Budureasca Origini Sauvignon Blanc 2016
fields.description:
Fresh, intense, with strong aromas are the key words to describe a white wine masterpiece like the Sauvignon Blanc from Origini Range.
The wine has a lemon color, with a nose of elder flower and passion fruit.
The body is well-balanced, with a high acidity, a predominant aroma of gooseberry and a medium aftertaste.

fields.name: Maximin Grünhaus Abtsberg Riesling Auslese 2018
fields.description: A classic selection that can also be drunk without accompanying food. The bouquet is dominated by the elegant fruity herbalism of the wine. The wine exudes tenderness and complexity, juicy, complex and calm on the palate. The optimal balance and the salty minerality ensure an exciting drinking experience. Although it is already a delight in youth, this wine grows towards its true beauty over the years.

fields.name: Ress Family Wineries Forbidden Pleasure LiebFrauMi
fields.description: The latest temptation from the Ress Family Wineries is LiebFrauMilch - Forbidden Pleasure. The term Liebfraumilch has been associated with German wine around the world for decades. The wines have long been dismissed as "sweet and cheap" - for too long. It is time for a paradigm shift!

fields.name: El Grifo Colleccion Semidulce 2019
fields.description: This white wine impresses with its complex aroma - notes of white fruits such as pineapple, quince and pear give it an extremely fruity-fresh impression. In the mouth pleasantly soft, fresh and with a good acid structure, which has a balancing effect on the sweetness.

fields.name: Olivier Leflaive Batard-Montrachet Grand Cru 2014
fields.description: Variety-typical character with strength: lime, vanilla and buttery notes. The maturity gives a full taste and a sharp acidity. We recommend decanting 2 hours beforehand.

fields.name: Joseph Drouhin Beaune Clos des Mouches Côte de Bea
fields.description:
Clos des Mouches white is a generous wine combining the body of Corton Charlemagne and the elegance of Montrachet. Its hue is bright, limpid, and pale golden. It has an elegantly perfumed nose of smoky citrus with tinges of vanilla. On the palate, the aromas are reminiscent of honey, almond, lemon and, as the wine gets older, grilled almonds.
[br]
[br]Admirably situated on a hill between Pommard and Beaune with a direct Southern exposure, Clos des Mouches is one of the most famous Premier Cru vineyards of Beaune. The name "Clos des Mouches" probably goes back to the beginning of the Middle-Ages (around 1550) because of its slopes facing South/South-East : a very favourable place for keeping bees. The word "Mouches" (Flies) was actually the local name for bees. As bee keepers started to set up their bee-hives, the area became known as "Clos des Mouches" (i.e. the Enclosure of the Honey Bees).
[br]After the destruction of the Burgundy vineyards due to the phylloxera epidemic of 1875-1880, Clos des Mouches was entirely replanted with Pinot Noir. Having fortunately come across some ancient documents which revealed that the vineyard had previously produced an excellent white wine, Maurice Drouhin, in 1921, began replanting with some Chardonnay. The result was of exceptional quality. To-day, there is an almost equal balance between white and red.

fields.name: Louis Jadot Chassagne Montrachet AOC 2018
fields.description:
This traditional vinification in oak casks brings forth the rich, plump fruit and full body of the wine, which shows a vigorous, aromatic bouquet and persistent, earthy finish.
The white wines of Chassagne Montrachet are the most robust of the Côte des Blancs, becoming less delicate and more straight forward as one progresses southward from the Grand Cru vineyards at the Puligny border.
Chardonnay is the only grape variety used for the white wines.
[br]Maison Louis Jadot vinifies the production of growers in this commune with whom they hold purchase agreements based on the quality of the fruit each year.

fields.name: Chavy Puligny-Montrachet Les Corvées des Vignes 20
fields.description: Very elegant, fine Chardonnay, definitely to be compared with the 1er Cru locations in the immediate vicinity.

fields.name: Miraval Côtes De Provence Rosé 2019
fields.description:
The terroir is located just North of Brignoles, in the heart of Provence, close to the village of Correns.

Clay & Limestone vineyard, partially in terraces located at an average of 350 meters. Cool climate for the area with big temperature variations between night and day.

The grapes are harvested exclusively in the morning and sorted twice. Destemming. "Pressurage direct" for Cinsault, Grenache and Rolle. The Syrah is vinified partially using the "saignee" method. Vinified in temperature-controlled stainless steel vats (90%) and in barrels (10%) with batonnage.

Beautiful light pale pink color.
On the nose, fantastic bouquet with delicate aromas of white fruits, just-picked strawberries and floral notes.
The mouth is complex with raspberry and wild strawberry notes, wild herbs, citrus, wet-stones flavors. It has a refreshing acidity - thanks to the altitude of the vineyards - and a round, long and vibrant
finish.

fields.name: Mathilde Chapoutier Sélection Grand Ferrage Côtes
fields.description: In the magnum bottle: full and delicious on entry to the palate, followed by notes of citrus fruits, grapefruit and white-fleshed fruits, which show a subtle, soft character that is underpinned by a fine acidity and gives structure.

fields.name: AIX Coteaux d´Aix en Provence AOP 2020 Methusalem
fields.description: Ein vielfach ausgezeichneter Rosé, der nach roten Beeren und Orangenschale riecht. Sanft mineralisch und harmonisch.

fields.name: Château de Fesles La Chapelle Cabernet d´Anjou Ros
fields.description: Aromas of red berries with light notes of vegetables. Taste: Fresh, round wine with fat and length.

fields.name: Canyon Road White Zinfandel 2018
fields.description: This wine shows his great mentality by light-bodied hints of strawberry, cherry, and watermelon flavors and a smooth crisp finish.

fields.name: Franco Españolas Diamante Rose Semi-Dulce 2019
fields.description: Semi-sweet rosé wine with strawberry flavors. Easily drinkable, with a refreshing acidity and soft sweetness.

fields.name: Grant Burge 10 Year Old Tawny
fields.description: The 10 year old Tawny is a full bodied wine with lots of taste and a brownish colour with some redish tones. On the nose complex fruity notes are shown. The alcohol is well integrated. Sweet and round on the palate whereby the aftertaste is kind of dry. Harmonious and balanced with tannins and ripe, developed fruit.

fields.name: Alpha Domus The Pilot Late Harvest Semillon 2015 (
fields.description:
Mango, orange and Turkish delight aromas give this wine an exotic bouquet. Marmalade and grapefruit characters result in an appealing citrus lift.

Rounded and luscious with flavours of marmalade and ripe tropical fruits. Grapefruit and honey characters are supported by fresh citrus flavours. A full flavoured, well balanced wine with a velvety mid palate and clean citrus finish.

fields.name: Kellerei Kaltern Quintessenz Passito DOC 2014 (0,3
fields.description: A bright golden-yellow dessert wine from South Tyrol, Italy. An ample nose of fruit, nutmeg, mandarin oranges, and exotic candied fruit. Smooth power in the mouth, orange peel and mango, the wine surprises pleasantly with a crisp finish. This wine is ideal as a dessert on its own, or to enjoy with ripe, blue cheeses.

fields.name: De Trafford Straw Wine (0,375L)
fields.description:
Attractive deep yellow gold colour. Great intensity and sweetness. Dried apricot, nuts, honey and burnt treacle. The palate is intensely sweet yet not cloying, fresh and lively yet richly oxidative with a long clean and complex finish. This vintage is best as a sweet treat on its own after a fine meal (or upgrade an ordinary meal!). A rewarding challenge to match with desserts!

The grapes were picked at optimum ripeness and laid out on drying racks in 70% shade for 3 weeks. This allows the grapes to concentrate sugars, acids and flavours, before reharvesting in the cool mornings. Fermented with natural yeasts and matured for 22 months using mostly new 225L French oak barrels. Racked while in barrel to remove heavy sediment and lightly bentonite fined.

fields.name: Champagne Gremillet Ratafia de Champagne
fields.description:
Golden topaz. Bright, luminous and limpid.

It reveals rich, voluptous aromas of dried fruit taking one on a journey to Corinth, Smyrna, Damascus and Malaga. The impression of alcohol is reminiscent of Cognac and Armagnac, with a hint of wood, vanilla and tobacco.

One should judge the taste for one`s self. It almost seems as if the golden liquid caresses one`s throat.

fields.name: Thanisch Lieserer Niederberg Helden Riesling Spätl
fields.description: With a distinctive interplay of aromas of apricot, nectarine and peach, this drop impresses even in the glass. Ingenious elegance paired with ripe acidity - a late harvest with lively freshness and refined delicacy. Delicious!

fields.name: Château d`Yquem 1er Grand Cru Classé Sauternes 200
fields.description: Beautiful golden-yellow colour. The bouquet displays great aromatic purity with very intense tropical fruit notes like passion fruit, pineapple, grapefruit and apricot. Barrel ageing makes it even more delicious. In addition, the flavours are in total harmony with the bouquet. This classically, elegant wine displays a perfect equilibrium between sweetness, acidity and alcohol on the palate, with an extremely attractive overall balance.

fields.name: Messias Vinho Do Porto Ruby
fields.description: This is a wine that is important to preserve the evolution of its red colour, more or less intense, and also to preserve its fruity character and strength inherent to young wines.

fields.name: Krohn White Port
fields.description: Strohgelber, weicher und komplexer Portwein, der mit tropischen Fruchtnoten, Zitrus und Blumen die Nase verführt und sich am Gaumen als wunderbar seidig, fruchtintensiv und mit einem schön süßen Finish präsentiert.

fields.name: Croft Pink Port Rosé
fields.description:
Croft Pink is the first ever port with a beautiful light ruby colour, achieved from light contact with the skins of traditional port grapes - lighter in style with a unique crisp and fruity flavour. Serve chilled or over ice in a wine glass for maximum enjoyment.

Attractive floral notes underline the pungent, aromatic raspberry fruit aromas. The palate is full of deliciously ripe cherry and raspberry fruit flavours with lovely nuances of honey and grapefruit.

This innovative new Rosé style of Port has been made by a new technique which extracts fresh, fruity flavours and a subtle and delicate pink colour from limited contact with the skins of classic Port grape varieties, grown in top quality vineyards of the Douro Valley. The result is wonderfully fresh and vibrant, full of the rich fruit flavours of Port but with a unique and distinctive appeal. It has created the perfect opportunity for Port to be consumed in the warmer months of the year when Port may not otherwise be the drink of choice.

fields.name: Niepoort Dry White
fields.description:
A rare style of dry white port, made with lengthy skin maceration and wood ageing. Best served chilled as an aperitif or as a long drink with tonic water, ice and a twist of lemon. "Dirk also makes the best dry white port going, with atypical elegance and freshness"

Tasting Notes: Golden / brown in colour with a delightful aroma of nuts and almonds which comes through on the palate with a fresh concentrated spirity finish, from extended ageing in small old oak barrels.

Vinification: The white grapes undergo long skin maceration, occasionally with foot treading in lagares, with fermentation carrying on to near dryness, before the addition of pure grape brandy. Ageing is carried in small old oak casks in our cellars in gaia for at least 3.5 Years before bottling.

fields.name: Ferreira Port Dona Antónia Reserva White in gift p
fields.description:
Der Ferreira Dona Antónia Reserva ist ein Portwein in goldenem Gelb.

Es hat ein intensives Aroma, mit Noten von bitterer Marmelade, einer blumigen Qualität. Auch exotische Holznuancen, getrockneten Früchte und Nüsse sind präsent.

fields.name: Fonseca White Port
fields.description: Rich, fragrant nose with aromas of mellow fruit and hints of honey and oak. Full body, velvety palate and long flavour some finish.

fields.name: Taylor`s Port Tawny 30 Years Old NV
fields.description: Only every two or three years is a reserve of port with sufficient structure, fruit and power to age, produced from Taylor`s own vineyards, laid aside to age in oak casks. Those that have reached their peak after thirty years are then blended together for balance and finesse, and to ensure consistency of quality and style. The 30 year old tawny shows incredible length with smooth butterscotch and caramel flavours.

fields.name: Gonzalez Byass Solera 1847 Oloroso Cream NV
fields.description:
Elegant, smooth mahogany-coloured Cream. It has an intense, clear, velvet aroma, with a fullbodied palate.



The seed that grew into Gonzalez Byass was planted in 1835 by Manuel María Gonzalez Angel, with Robert Blake Byass -his agent in England - only joining the firm two decades later. The two families remained in partnership through much of the 20th Century and the business has grown to be one of Sherry`s most recognisable and important names. In 1988 the Gonzalez family bought out the Blass family, taking sole control of the business.

The business is based in some fine buildings in Jerez, including one designed by Eiffel. This is a must-see for any Sherry tourist, as is popping inside to see El Cristo, which was purchased for the visit of Queen Isabella II in 1862. This gigantic butt is accompanied by twelve 6000 litre butts, representing the twelve apostles, which surround El Cristo, except for Judas, which is used to store vinegar! Today, the company`s cellars hold over 45 million litres of Sherry and Brandy de Jerez.

fields.name: Emilio Lustau Pedro Ximenez Murillo Centenary Sele
fields.description: Deep, dark brown and viscous. Redolent of ripe fruit with the distinct varietal aroma of the Pedro Ximénez. Rich, sweet, velvety and soft in the mouth, well balanced, with a long finish showing the wine`s great age. Awarded a Silver Medal at the IWC 2006.

fields.name: Valdespino Moscatel Promesa DO
fields.description: Die von Natur aus zuckerreiche Rebsorte Muskateller wird durch die Herstellungsmethoden des Sherrys aufkonzentriert. Rosenblätter, Mandel, Marzipan und Honig ziehen sich durch diesen wunderbaren Süßwein.

fields.name: Valdespino Manzanilla `Deliciosa` NV
fields.description:
Valdespino Manzanilla `Deliciosa`: A good depth of colour for a Manzanilla. Nice nose, fresh and herby. Good rounded palate, with weight and an appealing rounded fleshiness, balanced by a fresh crisp acidity. Good flavour and some length. Good example of the style.
[br]Valdespino stakes a claim as the oldest Sherry bodega, and it is hard to argue with six centuries of Sherry production as evidence. The family have been involved in making Sherry for around 700 years; exactly when they started up is not clear, the information lost in the mists of time. But in the late 13th Century, a Spanish knight, Alonso Valdespino, was granted 30 ha of vineyards by his king. From this small beginning the family established a reputation as an excellent source of the wine. The business which operates today, however, was founded as recently as 1875.

The family business is located in Jerez, in some of the city`s oldest and most attractive buildings. Unsurprisingly practices here are traditional, most notable is the fermentation, which takes place in cask for the vast majority of the harvest. In addition the business encompasses the bodega Manuel de Argüeso in Sanlúcar de Barrameda which is the source of the firm`s Manzanilla.

The range starts with the Manzanilla Deliciosa and Fino Inocente, the latter being quite full in style, veering more towards a fino-amontillado in terms of weight. There are two Amontillados, the Tío Diego which I find too full-on and structured for my liking, and the Coliseo. This latter wine is one of the stand-outs of the Valdespino range; frequently described as magnificent it has a powerful nose and flavour, reflecting the wine`s age. Some find it too much. There are dry and sweet palo cortados El Cardenal and Carrascal, a dry and sweet olorosos Don Gonzalo and Isabella, and the sweet Solera 1842, PX Candada and PX Viejo Reserva Superior.

fields.name: Gonzalez Byass Croft Original Sherry NV
fields.description:
Pale Cream is a subtle blend of the paleness and dry taste of a quality fino, with the intensity and full bodied palate of Cream.
With a delicate, pale colour, it is smooth and irresistible to the palate. This wine is best served chilled as aperitif or with pâtés, salmon or salads. It is also a wonderfully delicious alternative to dessert wines.

fields.name: Valdespino Fino 'Inocente' NV
fields.description: Valdespino Fino 'Inocente': A typically pale hue. Full and aromatic, with aromatic herbs and rock salt notes on the nose. Very nicely balanced palate, with a seamless integration of flavour, weight and grip. Nice herby-woody character, with a firm, clean finish. Lovely aperitif.

fields.name: Emilio Lustau East India Solera Sherry NV (0,5L)
fields.description:
In centuries gone by, casks of sherry were lashed to ships sailing for the Indies as ballast, and were found to develop an extraordinary smoothness and complexity. Lustau has revived this style of sherry in the East India wine. Unforgettable flavours of raisins, candied peel and nuts. Robert Parker`s comment: "Nutty, sweet, crème brûlée smell".


The people and history of Emilio Lustau SA provides the key to its current reputation for innovation today in sherry and even packaging. Recent developments in the marketing of Lustau sherries has been the creation of a sales and export consortium which joins together with Lustau two other great Spanish wine producers, La Rioja Alta from the Rioja region and Vega Sicilia from Ribera del Duero. These three producers operate in partnership with Europvin, the fine wine specialist based in Bordeaux. The consortium also has offices in the USA and Japan.
-1896 What is now Emilio Lustau SA was founded by Don José Ruiz-Berdejo y Veyan, an original Almacenista at Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza.
-1940 Don Emilio Lustau Ortega, his son-in-law, moves the bodegas to the ancient Santiago district.
-1950 The firm becomes Emilio Lustau SA, its size now enabling it to join the prestigious ranks of the select group of exporters of Sherry.
-1970 Company expands. New cellars constructed at the old family estate of Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza.
-1980s Emilio Lustau SA under new management of the late Rafael Balao. Becomes one of the most creative companies in Jerez.
1990 Luis Caballero SA takes a major shareholding in Lustau enabling development and expansion. Brings into Lustau 170 hectares of fine Albariza vineyard land at Montegilillo in the Jerez Superior region to the north of Jerez.
-2001 Purchase of traditional Bodega complex in Calle Arcos.Total refurbishment and Lustau now operates in Jerez from one central site.
